externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Script Management API

get.description: Returns script performance information for the specified `propertyId`, `hostname`, and `network`.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Script Management API

200.description: Collects information about each script's performance for both production and staging networks.

schema.description: Collects information about each script's performance for your Ion property on both production and staging networks.

production.description: List of scripts with analysis information and the actions applied on the production network.

items.description: Collects metrics about each script's performance. The top-level response object includes separate arrays for scripts running on the `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` networks.

action.description: The action taken on the script. `DEFER` executes the script after the page load event. `BLOCK` prevents the script from loading entirely. `NO_ACTION` loads the script normally. `NO_ACTION_LOCKED` prevents the script from being blocked or deferred to ensure it functions properly. `NO_ACTION_LOCKED` also applies to scripts that are necessary for Script Management functionality, such as when running [mPulse](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-m-pulse).

analysis.description: An estimate of a script's possible impact according to Script Management's algorithms. `HIGH` indicate scripts that slow page loading significantly. `MEDIUM` indicate scripts that have less impact. Scripts with `LOW` analysis are of least concern.

avgPopularityPercentage.description: The mean popularity value from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis.

avgTransferSizeBytes.description: The mean transfer size from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

avgTransferTimeMs.description: The mean transfer time from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

category.description: For `THIRD_PARTY` scripts, the type of functionality that this script or group provides, such as Analytics, Advertising, or Security. For `FIRST_PARTY` scripts, the category is the domain where the script or group resides.

group.description: For `THIRD_PARTY` scripts, a set of scripts with shared functionality. Typically, the scripts in a group are part of the same application. For `FIRST_PARTY` scripts, the group is the hostname where the scripts reside.

maxPopularityPercentage.description: The maximum popularity value from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis.

maxTransferSizeBytes.description: The maximum transfer size from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

maxTransferTimeMs.description: The maximum transfer time from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

minPopularityPercentage.description: The minimum popularity value from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis.

minTransferSizeBytes.description: The minimum transfer size from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

minTransferTimeMs.description: The minimum transfer time from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

party.description: The domain location for the script. Scripts on the same domain as your site are `FIRST_PARTY`. Scripts on a different domain are `THIRD_PARTY`.

recentPopularityPercentage.description: The percentage of beacons that included a reference to this script. Higher values mean the script affects many requesting clients.

recentTransferSizeBytes.description: The transfer size of the script resource. If your site compressed the script before transfer, this is its compressed size. A value of `Cached` indicates the user's browser cached the script. No transfer occurred.

recentTransferTimeMs.description: The average time, in milliseconds, it took for the script to transfer once requested. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script. No transfer occured.

spof.description: Whether your policy includes Single-Point-of-Failure (SPOF) protection.

testingSuggestions.description: Fully qualified URL of pages on your site that reference the selected script. This isn't a complete list, but shows only the five pages with the most beacons referencing the script.

staging.description: List of scripts with analysis information and the actions applied on the staging network.

items.description: Collects metrics about each script's performance. The top-level response object includes separate arrays for scripts running on the `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` networks.

action.description: The action taken on the script. `DEFER` executes the script after the page load event. `BLOCK` prevents the script from loading entirely. `NO_ACTION` loads the script normally. `NO_ACTION_LOCKED` prevents the script from being blocked or deferred to ensure it functions properly. `NO_ACTION_LOCKED` also applies to scripts that are necessary for Script Management functionality, such as when running [mPulse](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-m-pulse).

analysis.description: An estimate of a script's possible impact according to Script Management's algorithms. `HIGH` indicate scripts that slow page loading significantly. `MEDIUM` indicate scripts that have less impact. Scripts with `LOW` analysis are of least concern.

avgPopularityPercentage.description: The mean popularity value from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis.

avgTransferSizeBytes.description: The mean transfer size from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

avgTransferTimeMs.description: The mean transfer time from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

category.description: For `THIRD_PARTY` scripts, the type of functionality that this script or group provides, such as Analytics, Advertising, or Security. For `FIRST_PARTY` scripts, the category is the domain where the script or group resides.

group.description: For `THIRD_PARTY` scripts, a set of scripts with shared functionality. Typically, the scripts in a group are part of the same application. For `FIRST_PARTY` scripts, the group is the hostname where the scripts reside.

maxPopularityPercentage.description: The maximum popularity value from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis.

maxTransferSizeBytes.description: The maximum transfer size from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

maxTransferTimeMs.description: The maximum transfer time from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

minPopularityPercentage.description: The minimum popularity value from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis.

minTransferSizeBytes.description: The minimum transfer size from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

minTransferTimeMs.description: The minimum transfer time from previous insights within a one month period, including the current analysis. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script.

party.description: The domain location for the script. Scripts on the same domain as your site are `FIRST_PARTY`. Scripts on a different domain are `THIRD_PARTY`.

recentPopularityPercentage.description: The percentage of beacons that included a reference to this script. Higher values mean the script affects many requesting clients.

recentTransferSizeBytes.description: The transfer size of the script resource. If your site compressed the script before transfer, this is its compressed size. A value of `Cached` indicates the user's browser cached the script. No transfer occurred.

recentTransferTimeMs.description: The average time, in milliseconds, it took for the script to transfer once requested. A value of zero means that the user's browser cached the script. No transfer occured.

spof.description: Whether your policy includes Single-Point-of-Failure (SPOF) protection.

testingSuggestions.description: Fully qualified URL of pages on your site that reference the selected script. This isn't a complete list, but shows only the five pages with the most beacons referencing the script.

parameters.description: Set to `false` to exclude first-party scripts. If you leave it out, the operation includes first-party scripts in the response.
parameters.name: firstParty

parameters.description: Set to `false` to exclude third-party scripts. If you leave it out, the operation includes third-party scripts in the response.
parameters.name: thirdParty

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: __Enum__ The Akamai network where the Ion property with Script Management enabled applies: `staging`, `production`, or `both`.
parameters.name: network

parameters.description: A [hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/script-management/reference/script-mgmt-concepts) from the Ion property where you've enabled Script Management.
parameters.name: hostname

parameters.description: The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Ion property. Get ID values for all your properties using the [list properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/get-properties) operation in the Property Manager API (PAPI). Include the header `PAPI-Use-Prefixes: false` to remove the `prp_` prefix from the response output. The Script Management API doesn't support [PAPI prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/id-prefixes).
parameters.name: propertyId

post.description: Creates a new policy for the specified `propertyId`, `hostname`, and `network`. The policy request needs to include the `spofConfig` object or `scriptConfig` array item, but it can contain both. Only one policy can exist per `hostname`. A change to the `spofConfig` or `scriptConfig` overwrites the existing policy. If a policy already exists with the same `spofConfig` and `scriptConfig`, the API responds with a 409 error and displays the existing policy.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Script Management API

schema.description: The policy object shows how you've configured Script Management to handle your website scripts.

activationTime.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp representing when the customer last modified the policy.

policyNote.description: Comments to aid in distinguishing policy versions.

scriptConfig.description: A set of actions applied either to an individual script or a group of related scripts. Each policy needs at least one `scriptConfig` item or a `spofConfig`, but you can include both.

action.description: How Script Management handles the specified script. `DEFER` executes the script after the page load event. `BLOCK` prevents the script from loading entirely. `NO_ACTION` loads the script normally.

item.description: Specifies the fully qualified URL for the script on which to perform the `action`.

type.description: Indicates that the `item` receiving the action is the `URL` for an individual script.

spofConfig.description: Encapsulates settings for Single-Point-of-Failure (SPOF) Protection. This moves a call for a script to the background if it takes too long to load. The timeout value adjusts automatically in response to network conditions. Each policy needs a `spofConfig` or at least one `scriptConfig` array item, but you can include both.

advancedSettings.description: Encapsulates settings that control the upper and lower limits of the timeout range.

maxSpofTimeoutInSecs.description: Upper limit of SPOF Protection timeout range in seconds.

minSpofTimeoutInSecs.description: Lower limit of SPOF Protection timeout range in seconds.

versionId.description: The current version of the policy. It increments each time you create a new policy for a specific `hostname`.

201.description: The policy object includes information about which scripts or groups to manage. This includes the action to apply and single point of failure settings, if applicable.

get.description: Returns information about the latest version of a policy for the specified `property`, `hostname`, and `network`.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Script Management API

schema.description: Configures how Script Management handles your website scripts.

items.description: The policy object shows how you've configured Script Management to handle your website scripts.

policyNote.description: Comments to aid in distinguishing policy versions.

scriptConfig.description: A set of actions applied either to an individual script or a group of related scripts. Each policy needs at least one `scriptConfig` item or a `spofConfig`, but you can include both.

The timeout value adjusts automatically in response to network conditions. Each policy needs a `spofConfig` or at least one `scriptConfig` array item, but you can include both.
